summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to American Airlines, requesting passenger and other records for Ghislaine Maxwell for two time periods (1994-1998 and July 2019 onward). The document includes a request for non-disclosure to preserve the confidentiality of the ongoing criminal investigation.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subpoena requests all records for Ghislaine Maxwell (also known as Ghislaine Borgerson) from American Airlines for specified time periods as part of a grand jury investigation.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: The subpoena commands American Airlines to appear before the grand jury at the U.S. Courthouse in New York, though personal appearance is waived if records are produced with a custodian declaration.

events.title: Subpoena Issued
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office issues a grand jury subpoena to American Airlines for records related to Ghislaine Maxwell.

locations: U.S. Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
American Airlines Corporate Security, 4333 Amon Carter Blvd., Ft. Worth, TX 76155
The Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York issued a grand jury subpoena to American Airlines on January 23, 2020, as part of a criminal investigation into suspected felonies.
The subpoena specifically requests all records for Ghislaine Maxwell (DOB 12/25/1961) for two time periods: January 1, 1994 through December 31, 1998, and July 1, 2019 through the date of service.
The government requested American Airlines not to disclose the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.

The subpoena cites potential violations of federal criminal laws including 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c) (conspiracy to commit sex trafficking), 2422(b) (coercion and enticement), and 371 (conspiracy).
